revised_title: Beaded Villi of Lepidoptera-Scales: Microscopical Research in High Power Definition
tldr: Dr. Royston-Pigott discovers that the striated surfaces of insect scales, previously thought to be corrugations, are actually covered with villi, or chenille-like structures, terminating in a refracting spherule. This observation opens up a new field of research in the molecular structure of insect scales.
